laboratory_examinations.findings: White-cell count was 7800 per cubic millimeter.
Platelet count was 250,000 per cubic millimeter.
Erythrocyte sedimentation rate was 11 mm per hour.
Both prothrombin and partial-thromboplastin times were normal.
Two very-low-concentration bands in the slow gamma region; immunofixation revealed IgG lambda M components.
laboratory_examinations.changes_over_time: Follow-up study in about three months was recommended.

laboratory_examinations.findings: Cerebrospinal fluid contained no red cells and eight white cells per cubic millimeter (80% lymphocytes and 20% monocytes); glucose level was 64 mg per deciliter, total protein level 75 mg per deciliter, albumin level 57.1 mg per deciliter, and IgG level 8.1 mg per deciliter.
laboratory_examinations.changes_over_time: After lumbar puncture, the patient began to shiver, and temperature rose to 38.7Â°C; later, he was fully oriented again, but had some cognitive difficulties.

laboratory_examinations.findings: Dramatic resolution of the ring-enhancing lesions and minimal remaining white-matter abnormalities.
